title: We reject work and build an anti-work society, then what?
body: please  don't misunderstand my question  i'm as anti-work as it gets  but i am concerned about the possibilities of social reproduction of the basic necessities of people  i know that  with current technology  we could reduce the workforce a lot  but we still would need some organization in the transitional phase to full automation  which could last centuries    how would people handle this  would they really do it  work  for themselves  provided we make conditions as fair as possible of course  would we still need some coercion  should we use incentives  all of this is tricky because it reproduces the social logic of capital  productive ideologies  appraisal of the working man  etc  etc  but it's just that i think we have to use a gradual approach even today
